We ate breakfast, which was just okay, and then later had drinks, which were expensive, although perhaps not by LA standards. The hotel is in a marina, which was nice to walk around. We saw a dolphin, starfish and a ton of fish, so that was nice. There is also a nice walking area in the front of the hotel, providing good background for pictures. Another nice feature was that the hotel provided use of two computers with internet accessibility, sharing a printer near the hotel lobby. Staff was friendly, helpful, and competent. We truly enjoyed our stay at Doubletree in San Pedro. It comes highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: suave1948
Reviews.Content: Nice location, but.... The rooms are noisy, you can hear the neighbors upstairs as well as next door. I was in a room over the banquet area and had a band playing on two occasions less than 15' directely below my bed. As this was a business trip, all I wanted was quiet and rest at night. Plumbing was a problem, smelled like slight sewage in the bathroom and the toilet didn't drain properly even after complaining twice at the desk. Towel rack fell off the wall on its own one day. Restaraunt is expensive and food is average. Staff is friendly and try to help. I think the place is overated and over priced. Try the Sunrise or the Crowne Plaza down the road!

Reviews.Title: “great for pre-cruise adventure”
Reviews.Author: cruzincouple
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I chose the doubletree in San Pedro because we stayed at a Doubletree in Texas before our cruise out of Galvaston and enjoyed the experience. We decided to do a pre-cruise stay for our RCCL cruise leaving the 9th. We drove up from San diego and decided to make an outing of it and went to see the Aquarium of the pacific (outstanding! buy your tickets online and save $5.00 a person) and the surrounding marina area (also great). We also had lunch at a near by restaurant withing walking distance of the aquarium and the prices were reasonable.There are plenty of shops to see if you are into that and great areas for walking and lots of restaurants and you can get a good view of the Queen mary. Well we had a full afternoon and headed back to the hotel. We reserved the "park and cruise" package that included accomodations, parking for the week, champagne or cider and a breakfast buffett for two the following morning. Check in was quick and friendly and they gave us warm chocolate chip cookies which we saved for later. The front desk asked us to check in with the bell desk to arange for what time we would like to depart for the ship. The bell desk just asked what time we would like because they had scheduled times to depart and the just asked how many pieces of luggage that we had and said what time to meet in the lobby. That was it and took all of about two minutes. Our room was a king size non-smoking ground floor facing the marina which was very nice. The room was clean and was large enough. The bedding was crisp and clean and there were plenty of pillows. the bathroom had plenty of towels and the ammenities were neutrogena, including sunscreen (nice touch, for use on shore excursions) and face wash. We decide to walk around the marina and the hotel is next to a yacht club with plenty of nice boats, the grounds were well kept and we felt very safe in the area. When we returned to the room they had delivered the champagne on ice with glasses (more on that later). By that time it was time for dinner and you could eat at the hotel but we decide to ask the bell desk person what was in the area and he mentioned a good seafood restaurant. The hotel will shuttle you for free to places in the immediate area and then you just call up the number on the card the bellman gives you and they come and pick you up. It is a very nice service and my Wife and I enjoyed a nice dinner at the 22nd street pier (thanks Paul!!). What a perfect way to end a very full and enjoyable day. The bed was very comfortable and there was nothing that hampered a good nights sleep. In the morning after having coffee (Wolfgang pucks complimentary in the room) we decided to go to the buffett. I was not large but had just about everything you might want for breakfast and you could always order from the menu. They had hot and cold cereals, eggs, bacon, sausage, toast, muffins, juices, tea, coffee. We thought it was good and it was included in the package. By itself I think it was 18.00 per person, very convienient. Back to the champagne..we decided not to open it on arrival and instead make our own mimosas with some o.j. from the buffett. Another good memoy and nice way to get primed for a cruise ship departure! With the mimosas all gone we gathered our belongings and went to the lobby which is large and allows ample room for people to spread out with luggage etc. it is also a nice time to chat with other cruisers who are going to be on your ship. The shuttle driver loaded our luggage at the designated time and we were at the cruise ship terminal in about 10 minutes. the driver unloaded our luggage which went right to the cruise lines luggage handler and away we went to check in. Over all a very good pre-cruise adventure. Remember to keep an open mind when traveling and not to have too high of expectations but be informed and you might be pleasantly suprised more often than not. Check out our reviews on Cabo, Mazatlan, Puerto Vallarta and the rest of the cruise. Travel happy!!

Reviews.Title: “Could be so much more”
Reviews.Author: luv2gooften
Reviews.Content: Part of wedding party. Guarenteed a wedding party rate but had to negociate once we arrive. Front desk crew was very helpful and tried their best. Given room with a view and balcony as reserved. Discovered that the balcony was shared, but with no one from wedding party/family. View was marginal at best. Room okay but not up to Doubletree standards. Settled in for the night but was awakened early in the morning---discovered room was over the kitchen !!! Noise plus permeated with smell of bacon. Not a happy family member of the bride !!!! All this and the coffee was TERRIBLE How hard is it to make a good cup of coffee these days ????

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: sabinaa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice, right next to a Marina and we had a room with a view. The property is spacious with large outside seating, an outdoor swimming pool with garden and a great hot tub that fits about 10 people. Staff was friendly, the hotel seemed very clean and organized and the hotel rooms were pretty standard. I actually didn't expect this Hotel to be as nice as it was, but I ended up pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Sewage!”
Reviews.Author: jrengineer
Reviews.Content: Beware of rooms 105, 107, 109, 205, 207, and 209! We were unlucky enough to get room 209, and upon entering, the room smelled like sewage. I couldn't detect exactly where it was coming from, but it was overpowering to the point of making my stomach turn. The front desk was helpful, and we were moved to another room rather quickly, but a very honest housekeeper told us that the rooms I mentioned above were a known issue. For how long they have been an issue, I don't know, but the hotel definitely knew about this problem, but booked guests into those rooms, anyway. Were they hoping we didn't have noses? Our replacement room was fine, and despite this sewage issue, the hotel is pretty good. The pool and hot tub were nice, and the location was good--on the marina and away from it all. I would stay here again, but I'd definitely inquire about the sewage issue first. That was definitely bad, and they need to fix it. It is completely unacceptable to book guests into rooms that they know smell like a backed-up toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Port Of Los Angeles Cruise”
Reviews.Author: Rieba
Reviews.Content: Just like pictured on web. Hotel is adjacent to marina and shuttle ride away from Port of Los Angeles. Great for pre-night cruise stay. Restaurant breakfast and dinner food was good though pricey as all hotels are. Clean rooms. Would not hesitate to recommend or stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Marento
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful one night stay here this week. It's a lovely hotel and our room was stunning with marina-view and marble bath. It was clean, quiet, and reasonably priced. We stayed in room 337. We had to check out of a really nasty Long Beach Hotel at the last minute and we were looking for something close to Palos Verdes because we had a golf tournament the next day. Took a chance on Doubletree San Pedro and we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Glad I didn't pay full price”
Reviews.Author: DC_JetSetr
Reviews.Content: I'm typing this from the hotel as I think it's worthy of a below average review. Checked in last night to a smelly, small, obviously smoked in room, overlooking the dumpster area. It's a room that should be converted to something other than a place where people are expected to stay. Running the HVAC system only made it smell worse. I requested another room and was told the hotel was "pretty full".... so I waited. Finally they found me another room, which was more acceptable but average. The pool is in an awkward area next to the road, the HVAC system is much more complicated than it has to be (the instructions on the wall say "You will find instructions to the Heating/Cooling Unit inside the Guest Directory on your desk. Please call the Front Desk should you require further assistance." Why so difficult??) The room wasn't as clean as I expected, with fingerprints & smears on the mirrors, hairs on the bed, etc. On a plus side, they've made some nice improvements with the last renovation. It was refreshing to finally see a hotel honor the "hang your towels up if you don't need them washed to save water" theory... unfortunately there was no place to hang them up. Why no towel hooks? Maybe I'm getting picky in my old age...

Reviews.Title: “good room nice location, great pool and good gym”
Reviews.Author: jgorto
Reviews.Content: very nice room bed was super comfy and we have a tempurpedic at home. very nice pool and hot tub area which was sually pretty empty and quiet. nice balcony and view of harbor and slight ocean view. very helpful staff, two computers in lobby for guest use. Also i used the gym in the morning and it was pretty good.The negatives ac in room was broken and needed to be fixed. shuttle was not available when we needed it which was inconvenient. 3 dirtbags snuck into the pool 1 day and were really loud and obnoxious i called the desk which quickly threw them out. all in all a good hotel for 160 a night, we stayed for 6 nights and most of them were great except the night the ac broke. beach is a 10 min walk and is pretty nice...try rexs 4 breakfast on 22nd and pacific very friendly and great food.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: capoworm
Reviews.Content: my stay at the doubletree was not worth the money no vcr or dvd players in the rm ac did not work well in the rm hotel hall ways were so hot it was hot everywhere i dont think i have been in a hotel that was so hot my family and i were at the pool no towels had to call many times for towels did not come until mnger was walking around pool w/housekeeping staff then we got towels went to pool next day no towels spa was not working pool is not heated my wife and kids went to pool before we cked out no towels again called again did not come spa still not working 180 dollars anight should not have to call every time we go to the pool also no micro or little frig in the rm only plus was rm service i would have say they were great and free shuttle service to ports acall villager rich from orange county ca.

Reviews.Title: “I give it 5******”
Reviews.Author: Exbronx46
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved the Doubletree. Stayed one night prior to our cruise. Front desk staff is delightful and very accommodating. Anything I asked for, I got.......including an extra cookie! LOL Rooms are nicely decorated. WiFi available for a small fee in your room or use the hotels computers in lobby for free. We took Super Shuttle from Los Angeles Airport to the hotel as the hotel does not offer transportation from LAX. They do have a couple of shuttle vans that will take you anywhere in San Pedro and there is no charge. We asked about going to a supermarket for wine and soda to bring on the cruise and the van driver told us it was cheaper to buy at CVS and took us there....waited while we shopped and brought us back to the hotel. Next morning, they drove us over to the ship. The restaurant at the hotel is good but on the expensive side. No other places to eat within close walking distance. Nice marina area to stroll around if you want a little exercise. Speaking of exercise, I did see a nice gym, swimming pool and hot tub on the premises but did not take advantage of them. Would definitely stay here again if I were going to San Pedro.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: IowaCarly
Reviews.Content: The motel must have been remodeled since some of the last comments. Our room was beautiful, overlooking the marina, and perfect in every way. Staff was excellent. The restaurant has excellent food also. A great escape from a brutal Iowa winter this year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views Great beds Pets Welcomed”
Reviews.Author: Snoet
Reviews.Content: We were attending an event in Long Beach but the marina view rooms attracted me to this hotel. 15 minutes from Long beach with an easy highway drive through the Long Beach harbour I would recommend this hotel strongly. We had a marina view with a balcony. Beautiful way to wake up in the morning. Nice place to sit and watch the big ships come and go. Rooms were well appointed, althought no blow dryers in the bathroom. Bathrooms were not fancy like the rest of the room but were clean. Towels, bed, and view were all very opulalent. Towels thick and plentiful. The bed... WOW! Sooooo comfy with the cuddly comforter top and pillow top mattress below. Staff was super friendly. My big dog was no problem and was made to feel welcome not only tolerated. Breakfast buffet in the morning very reasonably priced. I would stay here again in a second. San Pedro itself is nothing to speak of but I did not spend much time there so I might not be totally fair in its assessment. And the hotel is not near anything convenient other than a great walk along the marina... which was all I wanted and I got that in spades.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: fankindagirl
Reviews.Content: Ok, besides the comfort of the bed, and some nice staff, this is not at a level of DoubleTree. The wall paper was taring off. The air conditioning remote was torn out of the wall. The bathroom was NOT clean. I found a hair in one of the towels, and the faucets were crusty. The shower curtain was moldy and dirty. The linens were so wrinkled I wasn't even sure if those were changed. The cookie was tasty though! Disgrace!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Meeting”
Reviews.Author: jruthg
Reviews.Content: My visit to this property was linked to a meeting at a nearby facility. The room was booked as part of a block (four rooms), so I had no part in choosing the hotel. That said, my experience during my five-night stay was--for the most part--positive. The bedroom/bath were fresh and clean, reflecting a recent remodel. Lacking, however, were an in-room safe and a small 'fridge. While not imperative, they are nice to have (especially the safe) and most hotels now offer these amenities. Service in the dining room (at breakfast) and in the lounge (evenings) was uneven. On some mornings, one server was attentive to needs like coffee refills and taking menu orders (as opposed to assuming everyone wanted the buffet). On other mornings a different server seemed absent minded about coffee refills, juice orders, and appeared to be reluctant to place a menu order. The wait-staff inconsistency carried over to the lounge, where on two consecutive nights a colleague and I (both female) wished to have an after-dinner drink. The first night a server greeted us promptly and took our order immediately. The next night, with the same server working, we sat--seemingly ignored--for some time until I finally went to the bar and asked that someone take our order. Desk personnel were professional and helpful, as were the support staff (shuttle driver and the bellhops). In fact, I arrived earlier than anticipated and was assigned to a room immediately. Check out (early morning) was equally smooth. Overall, I was satisfied with my stay and would--under similar (professional meeting) circumstances stay the San Pedro Doubletree again. As a native of Southern California traveling for personal reasons, however, I would opt to stay in Long Beach rather than San Pedro.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...staff needs training”
Reviews.Author: MamaCapone
Reviews.Content: The hotel is still under renovation but what has been completed is nice. I can't complain about the room, it was clean and we had a beautiful view of the marina from our room. My complaints are more with the staff…when we arrived we were given our room along with the keys. When we tried the keys neither one would open the door, so my husband put our luggage down and started to walk back downstairs to let the front desk know the keys didn’t work…just as he was leaving, a man opened the door we were trying to get into…they had given us a room that was already occupied. Thank goodness the keys did not work; it could have been a very embarrassing moment for all of us. The front desk assigned us to another room. The other staff problem we had was with the shuttle service person, the girl was very uninterested in helping us get to a wedding the next day…she said the destination we wanted was out of their range, they only go 5 miles within the hotel, well where we wanted to go was 4.8 miles. Needless to say we drove ourselves…she was very unaccommodating. Hotel nice, staff needs some work.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Be Forewarned!”
Reviews.Author: Millily
Reviews.Content: I am presently staying at this hotel--ten days and counting--due to home relocation and am now writing this review via my $9.95/day Internet connection. I am being charged $189 per day (pre-taxes) for a guest room with a king-sized bed and (partial) view of the harbor plus more $$$ for all the other optional, but, for me, personally necessary extras [Internet, microwave ($10/day), and mini-refrigerator ($10/day)] that are usually free at other like-priced hotels . The room price is way too steep given the fact that the room, while pretty clean and decent looking, is rather small. There are no screens on the window, which forces one to use the air conditioner, which is NOISY and dated. There are few available TV/cable channels and the maid service is only adequate. Over all, it's an overpriced hotel that charges much too much for semi-views of a marina and really robs one blind for Internet, refrigerator, and microwave usage, which, albeit, are optional additions. One plus, though, is the hotel is pet-friendly--but again, only at an additional charge!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Diamond in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: spkjones
Reviews.Content: This is a tough review to write. As others have said the hotel is wonderful. The views from the balconies facing to marina are beautiful. The lobby, rooms and other areas are newly renovated, clean and nicely decorated. The staff was all very friendly. The cookies - of course - are great. We paid $109/night for a Sunday night which was outstanding for the LAX area. We had cocktails in the lobby restaurant in the evening and the prices were reasonable - and the views area great. It was a bit cool outside - but I would have loved to walk around outside near the marina. I'm sure it is great. The problem is this. The area surrounding the hotel is not so great. There is a nice restaurant/yacht club bar just up the street which is nice, BUT as soon as you get past there - it was a bit scary. My husband and I took a drive toward Long Beach just to take a look at the Queen Mary and on the way back spotted what we thought was a Farmers Market @ one mile from the hotel. We thought we'd stop by. Let's just say we felt VERY out of place there and after one quick walk through we drove directly back to the hotel and decided to stay in for the night. The area directly surrounding the hotel seems very safe, but don't expect to wonder around nearby. San Pedro, itself, didn't seem like the kind of town I'd venture through in the evening to look for a nearby pub or restaurant. I hate to say it, because I LOVED the hotel... but I would not stay there again, nor would I recommend it to family or friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: bbnactex
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a cruise that leaves from San Pedro,this is the hotel for you. Loacation is peaceful and secure,close to cruise terminal,with free long term parking,and shuttle service to and from ships. The rooms are pleasant,view is excellent,in house dining is cozy. Overall ....the pool,hot tub,sauna,rooms with balconys(overlooking marina),grounds,and staff made our stay as pleasant as any on this trip. BIG "AAA" rating

Reviews.Title: “The Charm Is Back ----- AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: rubhed
Reviews.Content: Hello, If you read my review one year ago, I said I would probably never go back to this hotel even though we had been going there for years. Allot can change in a year and did! I looked all around for a hotel in the long beach area but I i could not get the double tree out of my head. So I looked on tripadvisor and noticed some users say that there was a massive renovation. I called the hotel and they said the renovation is almost complete. Wow I thought. So I booked the hotel 3 nights before our cruise. The first thing I noticed when we walked in was that the staff gives you warm fresh made chocolate chip cookies upon check in. The restaurant has been updated and looks great. The little gift shop has not changed and i guess thats a good thing. The carpet thoughout the hotel has been changed. The rooms have been completely updated with featherbeds and nice neutural colors thoughout the room. Everything about the rooms are first class. The rooms with marine views are great , the windows are large and completely open. Room service is prompt and resonable. I would come to this hotel for a weekend just to get away. You can't beat the location if you want a quiet relaxing hotel.The one thing you should know is that if you want to go anywhere from this hotel you will need a car. If you are coming from the Long Beach Airport it costs $35 to get to this hotel via taxi or van. The hotel has a free shuttle to the ship if you are taking a cruise. The hotel sits on a marina about 8 miles away from long beach and any activities, so rent a car if you want to do anything outside of the hotel. I mean anything. To wrap it up the hotel is in one word Awesome. I will stay there again when we cruise next year and I might make a few trips there before then. It is a home away from home. At the same time you are quite aways from Long Beach. So if you want want a great relaxing hotel out of the hustle and bussle of the big city this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: whosit
Reviews.Content: We Usually stay here every year for business and have seen the Hotel change names many times!!. We usually get a pretty fair deal but we tried booking for Jan 2007 and the prices have gone way out of line for the "CONDITION " that the property is in. They can make it look beautiful with the photos but believe me looks can be deceiving. Just my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Cindarella at the ball!!!”
Reviews.Author: bitybit
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here last summer and were quite hesitant to come back this time around. The place was in shambles last year, horrible room conditions, the staff was very rude & discurteous, etc. It was like night & day this time...the Hotel has just completed an $8.5 million dollar renovation complete with the new "Sweet Dreams" bed package, free internet in the Business Center, all new Teak patio furniture and the entire building is getting painted as well. They converted to Doubletree as of August 1st. The rooms are by far the best in the market.....and I feel they even rival some of the best Hotels in Long Beach just over the bridge. The shuttle to the cruise terminals was convenient & affordable and the Bellman were very accomodating. The food was incredible as well. They have this Seafood Buffet every Friday night on the patio overlooking the Marina, the view was breathtaking. We will definitely be back and tell everyone we know about the new Doubletree Hotel - San Pedro.

HotelInfo.Name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel San Pedro
HotelInfo.Address: 2800 Via Cabrillo Marina, Los Angeles, CA 90731 (Formerly Marina Hotel Port of Los Angeles/San Pedro)
